alert.note: Alert for Edwards (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 11:02AM CST until January 14 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing fog/drizzle. Total ice accumulations up to one-tenth of an inch. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 above zero. * WHERE...Edwards County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. Bitterly cold wind chills creating dangerous conditions on exposed skin.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state can be obtained at drivetexas.org.
